Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.String>, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event>
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event>, javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.String>
Controller connects the View class with the Model package for That's Life.

An integral part of the MVC program architecture, this Controller class links the View and Model aspects of this implementation. This class is responsible for coordinating what the users see (View) based on the data (Model) the program currently has in store.

This class also contains the EventHandlers and the ChangeListeners which are respoonsible for facilitating the GUI interaction in the View class.

  • Field Summary

    (package private) int[] nums
    An integer array that holds the indices of the House Cards to be shown when a player is about to buy a house.
    (package private) View view
    The GUI (View) of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(View view)
      The sole constructor of this class. Allocates a new Controller object (creates a new controller) with the View object passed to be controlled.
      Parameters:
      view - the GUI object to be controlled

  • Method Details

    • setupGame

      public void setupGame() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Initializes a new ThatsLife (Game) instance and sets the value of essential attributes such as player amount and player names. This also sets the board to show the start junction.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the files needed are not found

    • startGameLoop

      public void startGameLoop()
      Initiates the main game loop, whose main condition is based on if the game is already finished or not. This then calls other methods to execute certain action related to the state of the game (i.e. when a player is on the start junction). This game loop will end once all player have retired in the game. When this is the case, calls a method to show the winner of the game.

    • setPlayerStartPath

      public void setPlayerStartPath()
      Prompts the player to choose a path at the start of the game. This then executes the actions related to the path chosen by the player (i.e. for Career Path, drawing of Career and Salary Cards). This is always executed at the beginning of the game.

    • promptPlayerSpinWheel

      public void promptPlayerSpinWheel()
      Prompts the player to spin the wheel by prompting the View class to show the wheel spin window. This then displays the resulting spin number.

    • moveChecker

      public int moveChecker()
      Handles the player movement on the board. It checks when the player needs to stop moving (i.e. when a player lands on a Magenta Tile or the Retirement Tile). This also handles the reassignment of player space number whenever a player arrives at a junction.
      Returns:
      the number of tiles a player moved based on provided conditions

    • startPlayerMove

      public void startPlayerMove​(int move) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This is responsible for the car movement animation seen on the game board. It utilizes the Timeline class in order to create a movement animation. For every cycle of the animation, the player is also being moved from tile to tile. After the animation, the action affiliated with the landing tile is executed.
      Parameters:
      move - the number of tiles a player will traverse
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the files needed are not found

    • startPlayerSpaceAction

      public void startPlayerSpaceAction()
      Determines what the game would do based on the tile a certain player lands on. This then calls other methods related to the landing tile in order to executed the affiliated game actions. This also updates the player information panel found in the GUI.

    • startRetirementAction

      public void startRetirementAction()
      Retires the current playing player and will show their life summary as well. This is executed whenever a player reaches the retirement tile.

    • startMagentaAction

      public void startMagentaAction()
      Executes the Magenta Action related to the Magenta Tile that a certain player landed on. This will call specific methods to execute the Magenta Action involved with the tile.

    • setPlayerJunctionPath

      public void setPlayerJunctionPath()
      Prompts the View class to show the junction selection window. This is executed when a player arrives at a junction (except for the start junction). This will prompt the user to select which path to take.

    • startGetMarried

      public void startGetMarried()
      Executes the Magenta Action of Get Married. This is executed whenver a player lands on the Get Married space. This will change a player's marriage status.

    • startHaveChildren

      public void startHaveChildren()
      Executes the Magenta Action of Have Children. This is executed whenever a player lands on the Have Children space. This will increase the number of pegs a player has, if and only if they are married.

    • startCareerChoice

      public void startCareerChoice()
      Executes the Magenta Action of Career Selection. This is executed whenever a player lands on the Career Choice space. This will prompt the player to select a pair of Career and Salary card given two choices.

    • startJobSearch

      public void startJobSearch()
      Executes the Magenta Action of Job Search. This is executed whenever a player lands on the Job Search space. This will prompt the player to select if they want to change or keep their current career and salary.

    • startBuyHouse

      public void startBuyHouse()
      Executes the Magenta Action of buying a house. This is executed whenever a player lands on the Buy a House space. This will present the user with the house selection GUI from the View class.

    • startGreenAction

      public void startGreenAction()
      Executes Green Tile-related actions. This is executed whenever a certain player lands on a Green space. This will either execute Pay Day or Pay Raise.

    • startBlueAction

      public void startBlueAction()
      Executes Blue Tile-related actions. This is executed whenever a certain player lands on a Blue space. This will prompt the user to draw a Blue Card. The effect of the Blue Card is executed here as well.

    • startOrangeAction

      public void startOrangeAction()
      Executes Orange Tile-related actions. This is executed whenever a certain player lands on an Orange space. This will prompt the player to draw an Action Card. The effect of the Action Card is executed here as well.

    • startNextPlayerTurn

      public void startNextPlayerTurn()
      Shifts the turn to the next player, if the game is not yet finished.

    • handle

      public void handle​(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles all the buttons and other pressable nodes in the View class.
      Specified by:
      handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event>
      Parameters:
      event - the event which occured

    • getHouseIndices

      private void getHouseIndices()
      Generates randomly three integers to be used in the House Card selection.

    • changed

      Specified by:
